bow: besides wipe warmers diaper genies and designer baby clothes what popular items are necessary to buy when expecting your first baby post from beyondthebump sorry if this is common question that is reposted was wondering if some new and or experienced parents could suggest items to leave off of the baby gift registry what baby items accessories did you end up hating or never using on the same note what specific items were must haves when expecting your new baby any or all advice is welcome changing tables you can change their diapers pretty much anywhere the floor is best because they ca roll over and fall off have to disagree with you on that one if you re tall like my family doing something at counter top height is much easier on the back than getting down on the floor must have oxyclean it the only thing that will get all the stains out the floor is not that far away for me but feel your pain my bff is nearly tall and when she had her kitchen remodeled she instructed the contractor to make the cabinets and countertops about higher than normal she loves it ca reach the cups on the bottom shelf but still think changing table is waste of money there are flat surfaces everywhere bouncy chair never used it wipes warmer however was amazing first time slapped cold wipe on my daughter ass at am realized what godsend the warmer really was exactly so you change them on mat on their chest of drawers which wont be thrown out year later teething toys are pretty much unnecessary because baby will just chew on whatever have all kinds of fancy teething toys but bub favs are his wooden blocks and his blankets comforter sets for the crib you do need bumper pads or quilt plus they are recommended due to sids risk just get some fitted sheets would buy any bibs at first because most newborn clothes that people give as gifts come with matching bibs change table just get cheap change pad and put it on the dresser edit forgot to mention if you re breastfeeding just get nursing bras wear your bra in the shower with you hang it up and then put on the other one so much baby stuff is for parents convenience you have to decide what is important to you we loved our bouncy seat and baby bjorn but other folks have disdain for both loathe giant strollers but for others they are godsend go hang out with some families with babies see what you like and what you wish you had use with caution though it gives my baby rash could not do without bouncy chair it my baby favorite place to poop always did second rinse when used it anything that is not long sleeve footie onesie for the first three months at least in my case crib bedding sets seriously just buy fitted sheet or two it not worth 50 75 for the cheap sets for bunch of stuff you ca put in the crib anyway also hated those hooded towels it seemed like they did absorb as well as our regular towels only ever used them when there were no other towels clean which was almost never and you do really need special tiny baby wash cloths either dreft is expensive we already use hypoallergenic fragrance free detergent so it silly to buy extra detergent just for the baby stuff ve never had problem and my son and both have really sensitive skin me too she just has really sensitive skin and apparently lot of babies can be too sensitive for oxy clean would have never been able to shower cook clean do anything without my bouncy chair am so grateful for my diaper pail never had one with my son and his room always smelled like pee and or poop we tried to take the diaper trash out frequently but let be honest it hard to keep up with when you re busy with baby and general life now consider this to be necessary baby item other current favorites swing swaddle blankets like swaddleme etc some type of wrap sling carrier have moby and it amazing bassinet that rocks these things have helped me keep my sanity helped prevent excessive back pain and helped calm baby as for things that are necessary the biggest one that comes to mind is the whole matching bedding set bumpers are unsafe the quilt is more decorative than anything and basically all you need are sheets and maybe crib skirt for decoration someone mentioned changing table and have to say that while it is necessary it is very nice if you have back problems you do have to lean like when you change baby on the floor couch etc although if you have dresser that the right height you could save money by putting changing pad on top of it deleted deleted teething toys spent tons on the fancy sorts and our son just wanted to chew on whatever he could find the mesh teething thing that you can put fruit etc in was the worst he would freak out if we gave it to him our son loved to chew on his rubber ducks from the bath all the time so we ended up filling one with water and keeping it in the fridge deleted have to disagree my kiddo had colic and reflux it was one of the few things that could calm him down usually this might sound crazy but stroller they are so tiny for the first few months that it billion times easier to get around wearing them than it is to push huge lugging stroller also when have you seen baby crying in carrier never they love no need to be held it in their dna crying in stroller see it all the fucking time get ring sling for the first months then an ergo or mei tai to carry them through toddlerhood our girl is year and quarter now and we ve used our stroller maybe thrice always regretfully actually think you could get away with having kid and buying only clothes diapers and carrier goes to show you every kid is different our bouncy chair was used maybe twice she just never really dug it feel that way about the swing and her exersaucer could never get more than five minutes of use from the bouncy chair at my baby shower got these little containers for holding formula powder so it would be pre measured and would only have to mix it with water while out never used them also bedding sets are cute but not really usable until baby is about year and half my babies like to slam their heads into the side of the crib in their sleep so appreciate crib bumper after they re old enough to lift up on hands and knees to avoid goose eggs in the middle of the night survived just fine without baby monitor but guess if you have an enormous house it could be handy do have to disagree on this one my son will hold still on his changing table realized he ca go anywhere however change him anywhere else floor bed etc and he realizes that he has the potential to escape so he fights the whole time we had way too many bottles breastfed but kept bottles on hand just in case by the time was away from him regularly enough to need to offer pumped milk he preferred sippy cup so if you are staying home and breastfeeding bottles are space taker uppers even if you are going to work part time never needed more than four bottles my achilles tendon thanks you love our changing table it gives me one central spot to store all diaper related things and she knows what to expect when lay her there also it only cost 20 so it was not huge investment when was looking into detergents discovered soap nuts if you have heard of them you should check them out good for baby double as fabric softener and despite cloth diapering ve spent whole 12 bucks on them since november have swing on the porch that has gotten more than 10 minutes of use out of it know what you mean we always used socks on his baby feet and highly recommend not using clothe bibs even though sure you ll be gifted lots buy few plastic ones they work just as well and clean up is so much easier wait year or so and give away or regift the clothe ones to people you do know that well did you try oxi clean baby or the regular the baby formula is more sensitive yup mine were in pjs until mos they do need anything resembling real clothes until they start crawling ve always found that *someone* always likes something that no one else seems to use and sometimes you end up not using the things everyone else seems to like sadly it is often trial and error that why recommend buying used or borrowing where you can so you are out tons of money if something does end up working out but my recommendation is that if you want good baby carrier avoid the bjorn and snugglie because those just kill your back and go with ring sling wrap mei tai or ergo instead check out thebabywearer com for reviews and they also have neat fsot for sale or trade section with awesome gently used carriers scratch mittens my babies would keep them on for 10 seconds totally agree except that we found the ring sling was too hard to use before my son developed head control so we went moby gt ring sling gt ergo if had to drop one it would be the ring sling even though is is the most stylish that said at years old we use our jogging stroller lot for longer walking trips as long as there are stairs involved especially if we have other things to carry stick the diaper bag under the stroller carry backpack for groceries *never* used the giant travel system stroller with my second two kids as babies and only handful of times with my first just wore them in carrier until they were big enough for one of those little folding strollers that are 15 at walmart the giant travel system was such waste of money although since ended up with under twice would push the older baby while wearing the little baby and the big basket was nice to have for all the stuff that you need for two little ones disagree we still use it at months bc it my only place she will not roll all over the place to avoid change and this is my ultimate goal in life higher countertops mostly agree although will say the yikes brand hooded towels which are meant for older children are super fluffy work great for babies we only have one but we use it all the time mother of large 11 pounder at birth need my stroller carrying my guy is too hard on the back he months now and 21 pounds tried various slings and they were not only pain in the back but he loathed them and yeah he cried non stop in the baby bjorn feels restricted have an ergo use but he always cries the first minute or so edit have stroller with bassinette that was pretty cool when he was little the crib bedding sets are fine for toddler beds but you re absolutely right that none of that stuff actually belongs in the crib aside from the fitted sheets *spelling oh god the crib bedding spent 150 on ours we used the sheet most expensive crib sheet ever have to say the wrong carriers will kill your back also have giant baby 19 at months got boba and learned it was worth the money the way it fits really makes difference but get ya not all kids want to be worn controversial because co sleeping but crib my parents were generous enough to buy us gorgeous 350 crib which my 10 month old has slept in maybe nights and has survived couple of naps in there it convertible so hopefully she will eventually use it as toddler bed but if you re trying to save some money know that crib or fancy bassinet is not actually necessity pack amp play or cradle swing or cosleeping if that your style is just fine for at least few months edit wanted to add nursing bras some women like them but much preferred sports bras or cami that would pull down hate messing with the little nursing bra snaps all the time nursing nightgowns are also huge waste imo just sleep shirtless makes it way easier the only problem was nipple leakage when the baby was months old crib bedding is the one thing regret getting it basically really expensive crib sheet must have go with sleep sacks and muslin blankets use them constantly also fell in love with the rock play wish had it for both my kids because it been so damn useful baby accessories are such money pit agree that we completely over complicate it wish would have known that those were the only items needed plus car seat and would have stopped freaking out about not being ready when was pregnant agreed we bought one and all we ve used it for is place to put things we do want her to get into buy changing pad and you can change the baby all over the house trust me you re not going to get up and go into another room everytime you change diaper have bins of bottles literally *one* has been and is being used on occasion now if you re going to use pacifier get pacifier clip this keeps it from falling on the ground for safety only use when you re supervising at night use glow in the dark pacifier since they somehow magically disappear if the baby drops it from her mouth and starts fussing in the middle of the night know some people are against pacifiers but buy one before baby is born in case you change your mind changed my mind after trying to go without for the first week it was magnificent also like baby leg warmers keeps the legs warm helps socks stay on and easily removed if baby gets too warm makes diaper changes faster and easier too since you wo have to take any pants off basically scope out good children second hand shop get things you think you might like even if other people tell you they re not worth it try it out because each parent and kid are different there are things used all the time with my first and never with my second and vice versa and if you do use those things you did pay retail and you can always sell it back to the second hand shop or even on craigslist actually think the diaper genie is godsend it the only thing that keeps the poopy diapers at bay when they are in there for more than couple hours yep we got basic piece set when my son moved to toddler bed but we never really used the set we got when he was born with baby due in less than weeks we did even bother this time they really should just be toddler bedding sets and not crib bedding sets sophie the giraffe teether huge rip off you can buy so much used bouncy swing jumperoo craigslist is my bff no swaddle blankets they re good for about 10 minutes and then your kid is too big you can get the aiden and anias blankets at target or bru or if you suck at swaddling like me you can get the halo brand of actual swaddlers stay away from travel systems huge waste of money and you can buy small car seat do know of single child that was in one of those at 30 pounds personally hate baby wearing super closterphobic plus have bad back so it never worked for me we both hated it if you re like me you can get cheap snap and go on craigslist for 30 and if you use your stroller lot after that get nice one but can still go used agree with previous posters no bedding just bed skirt and sheets also nice thick cloth diapers for burp rags not those flimsy ones they use now also get rectal thermometer that has mechanism that stops it from entering too deep bru has one love for 15 good luck let me know if you have more questions for teething toys like that thing that looks like pacifier but it has net that you can put stuff in you can use it for teething and when they re older for healthier treat than popsicle with frozen berries eh there really is something to be said for taking your sleeping baby out of the car in his carseat and rolling him around still sleeping yes but children second hand shops know how to price things so sometimes you can get really awesome things at much better prices at just general purpose thrift stores today for picked up 21 cloth diapers with inserts hemp inserts +200 disposable liners plus some really nice pants and shirts for 50 piece at kiwani and got bunch of board books in really good shape for under 50 at value world you re going to expel baby from your uterus and starting getting up and down off the floor what if you have section asked myself this and knew there no way could deal without one got 175 swing and he was ambivalent about plus they re really only useable for about months if that spent the extra money because wanted one that plugged in instead of battery operated but it did matter because he used it rarely and were moving overseas where the voltage is different so we ca even use it there the teether stunk but my girls loved the regular squeaky toy sophie she was however gift so we did spend money on her ourselves deleted completely agree but did just discover way to save money by never buying the refills again trash bag just keep an empty diaper genie bag container and use regular trash bag through it boppy pillow is great for support while breast bottle feeding holding baby while she sleeps your back neck and arms will thank you also can be used for tummytime and once she starts sitting up now my husband uses it to pad his knees when he changes her diaper on the couch or bed and use it for my knees at bathtime look for things that can transition with the baby at different stages travel system strollers carseats high chairs that turn into booster seats toys that transform to engage baby from newborn to toddler we got crib that will turn into toddler bed she can use until she preschooler you will need burpcloths like you never expected expect to use few everyday at least use the inserts for cloth diapers since they re so absorbent and durable baby shoes are waste of money until they start standing and toddling outside they re cute though some means of listening to music it also helps tired parent get up and move around if you re too tired to leave the house we stream pandora on our tv or through speaker docks iphones have cheap cd player and some cds and stream through our car speakers our baby loves florence and the machine and muppets does have to be any obnoxious wiggles crap sensory balls that can be bought on amazon great for giving baby massage and great for playing too we used the hell out of those net thingies that you put food into and let them gnaw on if you re out at restaurant throw some suitable meat veggie etc in there and keeps them busy while you eat toss into dishwasher afterwards interesting put these on must have list both my kids scratched their faces up really bad if they did have them on for the first weeks or so bottle warmers seem like silly idea when you can heat bottle in bowl if hot water but they are actually really awesome actually really liked my wipes warmer and my babies seemed to appreciate warm wipe vs surprise cold butt just sayin listen to shirt thief if only would have known would never have spent hours wondering which cutesy bedding set to pick for the nursery forget it you ll never use that quilt and the only useful thing in it is the fitted sheet never used the bumbo seat for our daughter if were to do it again never buy it had lot of bottles but never considered them too many they were my insurance policy against having to hand wash any which did not have time for if was able to run the dishwasher one night ha ha liked cloth bibs just throw them in the laundry and hated the plastic ones that actually had to hand wash yuck we ve gotten ton of use out of our cribs but have to agree that it makes sense to wait until your baby is older to see if crib makes sense for you lot of newborns wo let you leave them in crib this was shocker to me since as new mother just assumed it would be easy to get the baby to sleep in crib if they were ready to sleep not true we ended up having our twins sleep in bouncy seats until they were about months old also if you let it sit on the clothes too long it will bleach them and or eat holes in the fabric learned that the hard way gt also when have you seen baby crying in carrier when tried to put my daughter in one she prefers being in the stroller because she can see everything and it was lot easier to plop her carseat in the matching stroller especially if she was already asleep general rule of thumb is that the only stuff you need right now is onesie and carseat everything else you can buy as you find you need it ok maybe confused about what changing table is we have short dresser that we put changing pad on top of would trade it for the world it can and will be used as regular dresser after we are done using it as changing table 10 and my husband is maybe that why we like it so much like having everything need to get him changed and dressed in one place instead of all over the house he is 16 months old and we still use it all the time do you have to get up to get diaper and wipes every time you change them anyway the damned shopping cart cover must get nightgown things that are stretchy at bottom we put changing pad on dresser in the bathroom the kind you can attach with screws on the back so it does fall off this lets us use washcloth with just water instead of wipes she has sensitive skin so this worked out better for us anyways saves the environment saves her skin saves money we have found his and hers diaper bag useful his is biker messenger bag we come from tall people so we went straight for convertible car seat instead of the infant carrier we do have baby monitor and she still alive after almost year our kid makes loud sniffly noises in her sleep so we put her in her crib in her room right away we re waiting to do up her room until she big enough to help choose colors and such she was never really interested in mobile the activity centers that have foam crossbar you can hang stuff from are great but you can get them at consignment shop for 20 instead of 80 new just put it through the wash while some are extolling the footie pjs we loved the over length gowns that you can just shove up in the middle of the night to change the diapers four swaddling blankets we have diaper service and used extras for burp cloths but if you do do that you will want lots of burp cloths our girl never needed those mittens that keep you from scratching yourself she was preemie and came home from the hospital with small bath two thermometers and squeezy bulb she needed comb and some mineral oil for cradle cap we really like our diaper service and got set up with about four months of it with our shower we like the people it local business they ll let you put compostables in the bin which we use overnight and it saves putting disposables in the landfill we do have laundry in our apartment or we do it ourselves but it nice to have one luxury she has really needed that many bottles you can get bottle brush at ace for instead of baby brush for 15 with nice packaging we use food mill and immersion blender to make her baby food good luck like the ones built into the clothes ca believe no one else said this lo sat in his maybe times crib is the one thing wish had had from the outset am not enjoying co sleeping but since she was months old before we even had crib she now believes them to be made of knives and wo sleep in one could have sleep trained her at an age when she was more amenable to it or just gotten her used to crib from day or baby might be willing to just drink formula at room temperature loved my snap and go pull the car seat out had simple frame that did take much space in my car and the carseat snaps right into the frame best part it was only 20 ve always wondered if that would work we re actually on our last refill going to give that shot after reading so many people opinions on different things makes me need to suggest that prior to buying most stuff have the baby be with him her for couple months and only get things as you see need for it and if possible only after letting baby try it out at friends house or at store the reason babies can be so expensive is that before we have them we ve read bunch of books and magazines and asked people what they need all of them have different answers and the reality is until your in the situation you do know even from birth they have their distinct personalities and so do you and your sig think back to our highchair and stroller purchases we bought high hairs not because we needed them but because we were trying to find the right fit for our situation first we were given full on high chair it was used frustrating and we could quickly assemble it for feeding so we bought new full on high chair that was ok but there entered nanny share and needed highchair for her at the other families house it had to be carted around on monday and friday cause we rotated houses for the share so we bought one that strapped onto dining chair then found deal on those restaurant style so we picked up of those so we could have something bit nicer for longer time and no longer needed to schlep the strap on one anymore yay so highchairs in years that was awesome yes we sold them all when done with each but so annoying none the less strollers were much better we bought bob for good reason we do own car live where it snows lot and while they do plow the sidewalk ramps always get plowed in we had to have something to get through snow on foot did want to wear my daughter when it was ivey or schlepping groceries home so yup we bought the suv of strollers then we wanted something light for summer but not 20 crappy umbrella ended up with nice one that an airline broke then had to buy new one to replace that ride on toys bouncers walkers bikes trikes balls toys it impossible to know what will actually be comfortable engaging etc take your time you do have to buy everything at once test it at babies us first and buy later have the ergo and moby and my kid has always hated both he months now without my stroller never have been able to leave the house with him you can buy almost everything used and it is totally fine only exception is the car seat which is good to get new so you know its history if you are doing cloth diapers you can even get those used generally do get anything before you need it so for example do get the big kid car seat until you have big kid because there are thigs you wo anticipate that you ca know until you get there best comment ever they pretty much live in sleeper the first few months sophie is also choking hazard ca link on my phone but google should produce the specifics my vote is for babyfood makers tiny steamer ricer blender units for as fast as they start eating table food that would have been massive waste of money if had gotten the one registered for use those baby wash cloths for everything use them as wipes mostly but also for giving her little wipe down after messy meal or cleaning up bit of puke or whatever probably just use them lot because they are there but they do work great as wipes the cloth ones with the plastic layer sandwiched in the middle are the best for drooly babies or babies that spit up lot absorbent amp waterproof at the same time those things are awesome no zips no snaps just took them all out of my 11 week old dresser and put them in the give to my pregnant friend pile sigh he was so cute in them our little friar they went well with his male pattern baldness my bouncy chair is the only reason am clean one teething toy my kid did love was these keys that had gel that could go in the freezer they were rather inexpensive but he just loved them when they were icy cold all the rest yeah not needed yes loved that and miss it my son also went through phase in the first few months where the only way he would stop crying and sleep was if took him for walk in the stroller bonus points it was winter no snow luckily side note the graco quattro tour is one heck of workhorse my husband and recently tallied up and realized it logged well over hundred miles in the last two years agree on the socks shoes on non walkers are just expensive decoration do have to say loved the cheapy cloth bibs during his drooling phase that kid was faucet once you can exercise again and if you re outdoorsy bob stroller yes they re 350 yes that sounds crazy but use mine every day it glides like actual buttah losing weight and the activity is absolutely critical for keeping me from going full on yellow wallpaper stuff bunch of diapers and spare onesies in the bottom clip the pacifier to the safety harness ipod and go out for hours stop at the park to feed and hang on the grass kid sleeps or gazes around only cries when stop little worked up about this stroller and need to calm down amen my twins wore footie jim jams exclusively for the first months of their lives screw any clothes that have to fidget with have too much to do already without having to pull up socks adjust pants or pull down shirts that have ridden up throughout the day the only reason the babies do wear them 24 anymore is that it hot enough for rompers and onsies during the afternoon we put socks on our son hands since they were too small for his massive yeti feet the baby bathtub was totally unnecessary for us our baby hated it and eventually just took baths with him and held him in my lap he was much more calm got better hold on him and it was an opportunity for me to get clean too when that did always happen in the early weeks upvote for the moby agree with the quilt sets my mom bought us one and only use the sheet do have the heart to tell her ours came with mobile though and that come in handy for us we did need baby monitor for the first months mostly because was so paranoid and had my baby with me at all times ve relaxed little now but still usually with baby out of habit suppose so the monitor still does get much use we put baskets for toys on the shelves of my sister changing table that thing stayed in her room until she was wish that would have worked for us the crib was knives from day for her could you link some quality legwarmers the ones have always fall down her legs right away oh my you hit the cloth diaper jackpot lady that amazing but yes shop around everywhere thrift shops second hand shops craigslist also check out prices on amazon target and walmart before purchasing things you think you ll use lot sometimes its not much more expensive to buy new and you ll most likely get the extra 10 use out of it most second hand stores including thrift stores will hold items until the end of the day so you have time to do some shopping wipe the table the baseboards clean door handles use as mini mop after spill just ca get enough if those wipes will buy them for the rest if my life regular ll have to check out the baby stuff thanks no prob everytime this question comes up there is strange vitriol toward changing tables *love* mine got it for 20 off craig slist and it been used and used and used have twins and had section there is no way in hell was going to get down onto the floor for 10 12 changes day for each baby would have been able to get up off the floor once let alone 25 times day it has dresser drawers and cabinet so keep all the baby clothes diaper supplies medical supplies in it use it to change diapers change clothes use the nosefrida administer medicine and sometimes just for raspberries and tummy kisses have hooks above it that hang special toys from that they only get when they re on the table both babies really like it when we set them up there and get extra smiley and giggly understand that different families have different needs and different styles but would never council pregnant woman against diaper change table especially for 20 even if get rid of it after the first year it will have been more than worth it here my table http imgur com ona6ayw jpg when was setting up the nursery it now has basket with two different sizes of diapers and big industrial diaper pail made for daycares and assisted living centers next to it we used ours twice to each their own our baby is months old and she has gotten single tooth yet she been teething since four months every day it any day now and now we re convinced she ll never get tooth in the meantime she thrown off every effort to make her feel better no teething toys work for her she wo take to them instead she gnaws on her hand or on my hand *shrugs* think the people that think wipe warmers are waste of money did have their babies in cold climate if you have your baby in texas in june it waste if you have it in minnesota in january it very helpful those swaddler velcro wrap blankets baby totally rejected them really most newborn clothes we kept him in loose blanket the vast majority of the time since we do live in cold climate we cosleep and baby hated having his upper body constricted my goal was to cosleep but not bedshare so bought the arms reach cosleeper biggest waste of money ever it immediately became clear that bed sharing was the only way anyone was getting sleep baby was not satisfied in the least by the cosleeper the whole point was that he needed to be against my body since he nursed every hrs for like 40 min at stretch the bedshare arrangement was key we chose to do that as safely as possible and all has been well almost years later did really need stroller until ds was months old my diaper genie was key omg used it with our cloth and then disposable dipes and it has been awesome do not scoff at these like the arm hammers one really keeps the odor down detergent hear is waste no baby yet but we are due in june and at our infant care class the nurses stressed this point because if you are holding baby baby skin is going to come in contact with whatever detergent you use for your own clothes anyway so unless you re washing everything in dreft it moot point want one of these so bad but have two kids so it like 500 for stroller just ca justify it to myself highly recommend diaper genie it one of the most used baby products in our house and traps smell way better than trash can have found that zout works much better and zip up for all sanity zip up mine is in snaps daddy did it and at 1:45am was cursing snaps and saying the inventor needs to be dragged into field and shot the crotch never lines up we tried it with scented bags even and it did work nearly as well after giving it trial of few weeks we decided the cost of the genie refills was worth it borrowed ring sling could not feel he was secure in it gifted bjorne hubby wears it as it kills my back bought an ergo with infant insert after borrowing my sil worth every penny even put my two year old in for funsies she was thrilled with facing me ergo all the way it did keep out the smell however target has their own brand super cheap gt bonus points it was winter sounds like your lo was nordic people from finland and norway believe it good for baby health to sleep outside in the cold http www bbc co uk news magazine 21537988 one of the things got the most use out of the first or mos or so was his moses basket friend of ours had bought the basket and made custom pad for the inside loved it because after gave birth was going through this finally got this thing out of me phase the basket gave me the opportunity to have him in the same room without having to hold wear him we called our swing the chair of apathy because the minute put him in there he would calm down immediately we had one of those fancy ones that went side to side as well as back and forth though we rarely used the back and forth feature it was always side to side for us and he loved it we did have quattro but our big stroller was workhorse and was so sad when he finally outgrew it because it held up so well somebody probably my mom had given us these cutesy bottles with winnie the pooh theme which was also our nursery theme but we never used them because boy hated them they did have the right nipples that good point plus it so much easier to just throw the baby stuff in with the rest of the clothes we also get soap and lotion for sensitive skin so do bother with separate infant toiletries either it crazy how much stuff got for my son that not getting this time around have couple pairs of really cute hand crocheted booties that my husband grandma made for us before boy was born he never got to wear them however because he also had giant yeti feet at birth one of my favorite pictures is of nurse or whoever holding him up so we can see the inkstains from where they took his foot prints remember my fil who was in the room taking pictures going holy crap look at them paws billion up votes for zippers no one wants to fiddle with at least snaps my personal best every time you change diaper we had both bassinette and crib we used the bassinette the first three months or so until he outgrew it and then the crib we never had an issue with him sleeping in either one the bassinette was gift from somebody but it got plenty of use because after we used it we passed it onto my sil who oldest preemie was just coming hom from the hospital about the time we finished using it then it went to my mils for storage and back to sils for
